Metadata: Molecular factors associated with virulence of marine vibrios isolated from striped bass in Chesapeake Bay

Pathogenic strains of "Vibrio anguillarum" isolated from Pacific Northwest fish are able to grow under iron-limited conditions, withstand the bactericidal action of normal fish serum, and contain a virulence plasmid, pJM1. Here Atlantic vibrios are compared with their Pacific counterparts by phenetic and DNA homology assays and shown to be similar--with the curious exception that virulent strains harbored no plasmids (even while some non-virulent strains did).
